column4: so I have some linux/unix experience, I want to boot off the ubuntu disc and reformat a multi-part sd card that my android phone ate and it can't be seen by the phone or in windows. What tool could help me?
you might be able to repair it. what do you mean "multi-part sd card"?
it has an ext3, swap and fat32 partition
and just the fat32 is messing up?
no, the phone can't see any of it
could the phone normally see ext3?
yes, it could see all the partitions
well you can probably fix it with fsck
hmm
i'm fine with repartitioning it
but now i'm interested... whats the advantage of ext3 and swap on a sd card in a droid? my sd is fat32
well I'm too in to fiddling, but I have it set up using a tool to run apps from the ext3 partition off the sdcard
since i have a large/fast sd card
nice.. well you can use parted or gparted to repartition in ubuntu, but all info would be lost
I'm assuming all is lot anyway
its likely just a little error and totally recoverable
well I do have access to fsck on the phone
i just can't figure out the device name
/dev/block/mmcblk0p[0-2]
hmm
wanna help my on the syntax?
maybe it doesn't..haha
